column5: 1405年，马来群岛
column12: In the year 1405, somewhere in the Malay Archipelago.

column5: 搬快点搬快点！货舱里进了雨水，再泡下去剩下的粮食也得完蛋！
column12: Move it, move it! Water's leaking into the cargo hold—if it soaks any longer, all the remaining rations will be ruined!

column5: 这鬼地方，之前明明还好好的，前天忽然碰上了风暴，邪了门了
column12: Damn this place. It was calm before, and then suddenly, a storm hit two days ago. Something’s off.

column5: 还傻站着干什么，快去搬——
column12: Why are you still standing there? Start moving—

column5: ...你是前几天朝廷派来的医官？
column12: …Are you the imperial physician sent by the court a few days ago?

column5: 正是，先前到来时风雨大作，未能及时拜访实在抱歉
column12: Indeed. The storm was fierce when I arrived. My apologies for not reporting in earlier.

column5: 哼，少来这套，谁知道你这名头是不是拿钱买来的。
column12: Hmph. Spare me the formalities. Who knows if that title of yours wasn’t just bought with silver.

column5: 去找船舱里看看老鲁吧，这几天他和几个手下上吐下泻，都快把命丢了
column12: Go check on Old Lu in the cabin. He and a few of his men have been vomiting and purging nonstop. They’re barely hanging on.

column5: 下层船舱
column12: Lower deck cabin.

column5: 呃啊...医官大人...我肚子像被鲨鱼撕咬...呕——
column12: Urgh... Doctor... My stomach feels like it’s being torn apart by sharks… *hurl*

column5: 全身发冷...但骨头里又像着了火…
column12: I’m freezing... but my bones feel like they’re on fire...

column5: 大人！三十多人倒下了...是不是...是不是我们触犯了海神？
column12: Sir! Over thirty have collapsed... Could it be… have we offended the Sea God?

column5: （舱内霉味刺鼻，汗臭与呕吐物混作一团...这舌苔白腻如雪，脉象濡缓——分明是湿浊困脾！）
column12: (The stench of mold, sweat, and vomit fills the cabin… This thick, greasy white tongue coating, and the soft, sluggish pulse—it’s clearly dampness obstructing the spleen!)

column5: 带我去货舱看看。
column12: Take me to the cargo hold.

column5: 货舱
column12: Cargo hold.

column5: 这批稻谷都长了绿霉...水手们连日吃这个？
column12: This rice has turned green with mold… The sailors have been eating this for days?

column5: 前日风暴打湿了粮仓...但不吃这个吃什么？
column12: The storm soaked the grain stores the day before yesterday… but what else can we eat?

column5: 木板都能渗出水来...加上南洋的闷热，难怪湿邪入体。
column12: Even the wooden planks are seeping with moisture… Combined with the southern humidity, no wonder the dampness has invaded their bodies.

column5: （《黄帝内经》云'湿胜则濡泻'...需要既能解表散寒，又能芳香化湿的方子...）
column12: ('The Inner Canon of the Yellow Emperor' says: ‘Excessive dampness leads to diarrhea’… I need a prescription that releases the exterior, dispels cold, and transforms dampness with fragrance…)

column5: 大人！生姜只剩两斤，肉桂全被海水泡坏了！
column12: Sir! We’ve only got two jin of ginger left, and all the cinnamon was ruined by seawater!

column5: （肉桂…倒是无妨，关键是...）
column12: (Cinnamon… that’s not crucial. What matters is…)

column5: 还好...藿香、紫苏、陈皮都完好…
column12: Thankfully… the agastache, perilla leaf, and dried tangerine peel are still intact.

column5: 请选择治疗方案
column6: ["立即用生姜煮水，先发汗退热！", "按《局方》记载，调配藿香正气散"]
column12: Please choose a treatment formula.
column13: ["Boil ginger immediately to induce sweat and reduce fever!", "Prepare Huo Xiang Zheng Qi San as recorded in the Imperial Prescriptions"]

column5: 热！好热！
column12: Hot… so hot…

column5: 肚子...肚子要裂开了…
column12: My stomach... it’s going to explode…

column5: 你这杀千刀的！来人啊，把他捆起来！
column12: Damn you! Someone tie him up!

column5: （糟了！单用生姜发汗，反而耗伤津液...湿邪更盛了！该用藿香配合...）
column12: (No! Using just ginger to induce sweating has depleted his fluids... The dampness has worsened! I should’ve used agastache in combination...)

column5: 甲板上，众人好奇地围着医官
column12: On deck, the crew gathers around the physician with curiosity.

column5: 大人！药材都找齐了！
column12: Sir! We’ve gathered all the herbs!

column5: 藿香叶清香透达，正是上品。记得师父说过："藿香如君子，芳香而不烈，化湿而不燥。"
column12: Agastache’s scent is clean and penetrating—it’s a superior herb. I remember my master saying: “Agastache is like a gentleman—fragrant but not overpowering, dispelling dampness without drying out.”

column5: 藿香三钱化湿浊为君，紫苏两钱散寒为臣...
column12: Three qian of agastache to transform dampness as the monarch; two qian of perilla to dispel cold as the minister...

column5: 等等，这杆秤被盐蚀了？
column12: Wait a moment, has this scale been corroded by salt?

column5: 啊！昨日的浪打湿了药箱！
column12: Ah! The medicine box got wet in yesterday’s waves!

column5: 用这个吧，这是随船的护身符，刚好重一两。
column12: Use this—it’s the ship’s talisman. It happens to weigh exactly one liang.

column5: 紫苏辛散，久煎则香气走窜...
column12: Perilla is pungent and dispersing—if boiled too long, the aroma escapes…

column5: （不对，书中有云："凡药，遇潮则性改"，如今药材长时间受潮...）
column12: (No… the pharmacopoeia states: “When herbs are exposed to moisture, their properties change.” These herbs have been damp for too long…)

column5: 人群中传来一阵嘈杂
column12: A commotion rises in the crowd.

column5: Doctor！加些我们的肉豆蔻？保准药到病除！
column12: Doctor! Add some of our nutmeg—guaranteed to cure all ailments!

column5: 或者撒点黑胡椒？在亚历山大港这可是神药！
column12: Or a dash of black pepper? In Alexandria, it’s considered a divine remedy!

column5: 不可，这等辛热之物若混入药中...
column12: No! Such hot and pungent substances, if added to the medicine…

column5: （等等...《本草衍义》提到过，外邦香料多燥烈...）
column12: (Wait… the 'Supplement to the Materia Medica' mentions that foreign spices tend to be hot and drying…)

column5: 是否添加异域香料？
column12: Would you like to add foreign spices?

column5: ...试试看吧
column12: …Let’s give it a try.

column5: 我的喉咙...在燃烧...
column12: My throat… it’s burning…

column5: 我的老天啊...
column12: Oh heavens above…

column5: 症状无改善，部分船员开始出现昏沉、心悸。你开始怀疑自己的选择
column12: Symptoms show no improvement. Some sailors begin to experience drowsiness and palpitations. You start to doubt your decision.

column5: 半个小时后
column12: Half an hour later.

column5: 成了！
column12: It’s done!

column5: 看这金丝纹路...师父说过，这是'正气汤成'的吉兆。
column12: Look at this golden thread pattern… My master once said this is an auspicious sign that the “Zheng Qi Decoction” is complete.

column5: 趁热小口饮下，饮后静卧...记住，若觉周身微汗，万不可掀被。
column12: Sip it while it’s hot, then lie down and rest… Remember, if you feel a slight sweat, do not uncover the blanket.

column5: 谢谢！谢谢大人...我们有救了！
column12: Thank you! Thank you, sir… You’ve saved us!

column5: 一天后，船员们的症状逐渐缓解
column12: A day later, the sailors’ symptoms begin to subside.

column5: 哼，你这医官还真有两下子。
column12: Hmph, looks like you’re more capable than you seemed.

column5: 谢谢您医生！您救了我一命！
column12: Thank you, doctor! You saved my life!

column5: 尊敬的医生，请务必告诉我这个神奇配方的名字！
column12: Respected physician, please—tell me the name of this miraculous remedy!

column5: 此方名为
column12: This prescription is called—

column5: 藿香正气散。
column12: Agastache Qi-Correcting Powder
